titleStmt.title: Monsieur Acarete du Biscay's Journey from Buenos Ayres to Peru

body.head: Monsieur Acarete du Biscay's Journey from Buenos Ayres to Peru

div.p: I Left Buenos Ayres, and took the Road I to Cordoua, leaving Santa Fe on my right hand, of which place take this account, 'tis a Spanish Settlement dependant upon Buenos Ayres, the Commander is no more than a Lieutenant, and does nothing but by order from the Governor of Buenos Ayres. 'Tis a little place containing 25 Houses, without any Walls, Fortifications, or Garrison, distant 80 Leagues from Buenos Ayres Northward, Situate upon the River de la Plata, large Vessels might come up to it, were it not for a great bank that obstructs the passage a little above Buenos Ayres. Nevertheless 'tis a very advantageous Post, because 'tis the only passage from Peru, Chili and Tucuman to Paraguay, and in a manner the Magazine of the Commodities drawn from thence, particularly that Herb already spoken of, which they cannot be without in those Provinces.
